Others: The Mavericks passed out a season-best 33 assists in their 119-99 victory over Chicago Bulls.
Kyrie Irving and Luka Dončić were instrumental in the Mavericks' ball movement strategy.
Jason Kidd emphasized the importance of sharing the ball and multiple players touching it in the league.
Irving stated that consistency is key to maintaining the share-the-wealth strategy.
The Mavericks played faster and the ball was whizzing around the court, with fewer half-court sets.
Dwight Powell stepped in at backup center in the absence of Dereck Lively II and provided solid minutes.
O-Max Prosper was solid enough to give Naji Marshall and Klay Thompson some rest periods.
Naji Marshall had eight points, two steals and the Mavericks were plus-18 during his 21 minutes on the floor.
The Mavericks corrected their rebounding deficit in the second half, giving the Bulls just five second-chance points.
Markieff Morris is expected to join the front line rotation due to injuries.
All 17 Mavericks have seen action in at least one game, including two-way players Kessler Edwards, Brandon Williams and Jazian Gortman.
